Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck amphora; exterior: from left, painted black handle zone; black-figure decoration consisting of cloaked woman (only back, tresses and part of cloak in added white remaining), to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the female figure, see British Museum 1965,0930.826.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 39, pl. 23, no. 31)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 128, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.110) (phase 3)
